subject: temporarily skip help tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 03:01:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/test_shell.py'], 'message': "temporarily skip help tests

We're trying to change cliff for the better, by improving the UX
of the help command. But cliff tests against the tip of OSC.

Temporarily skip the tests that are failing and then update them
once the fix for cliff has been merged.

The patch in question: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201258/

commit_message:
temporarily skip help tests

We're trying to change cliff for the better, by improving the UX
of the help command. But cliff tests against the tip of OSC.

Temporarily skip the tests that are failing and then update them
once the fix for cliff has been merged.

The patch in question: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201258/

Change-Id: Ie1e7ddd66477ddf4a3bafedad12934e900ace48f

commit_message:
Switched merlin to use javascript-jobs

This patch effectively adds the npm-run-lint command to merlin's
gate queue, and removes the non-voting flag.

subject: Use an Anchor when service is managed
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 14:43:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/keystone_service.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb', 'spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_tenant.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_role.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_domain.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_endpoint.rb'], 'message': "Use an Anchor when service is managed

Today, Keystone resources (domains, tenants, etc) are created only if
'keystone' service is started.
When running Keystone in WSGI, the autorequire is broken for those
resources.
Adding 'httpd' in autorequire is not enough because it could fail to
orchestration issues if running another httpd resource (Horizon) that
depends on having Keystone started.

This patch is about to create an Anchor (keystone_started) in
keystone::service that require Service['keystone'] resource to be
created.
In resource types, change the autorequire to depend on the new Anchor.

With that patch, we are sure Keystone resources won't be created before
service is actually managed (running or stopped) and other resources
(Horizon, using httpd server) can also depend on this Anchor if needed.

Change-Id: Ie72b65b6be224cadc8730e050bec38d2face5dfd
Closes-bug: #1474059
(cherry picked from commit c11b0408ef0f2d98749106cabc47c7d0b9268b4c)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use an Anchor when service is managed

Today, Keystone resources (domains, tenants, etc) are created only if
'keystone' service is started.
When running Keystone in WSGI, the autorequire is broken for those
resources.
Adding 'httpd' in autorequire is not enough because it could fail to
orchestration issues if running another httpd resource (Horizon) that
depends on having Keystone started.

This patch is about to create an Anchor (keystone_started) in
keystone::service that require Service['keystone'] resource to be
created.
In resource types, change the autorequire to depend on the new Anchor.

With that patch, we are sure Keystone resources won't be created before
service is actually managed (running or stopped) and other resources
(Horizon, using httpd server) can also depend on this Anchor if needed.

Change-Id: Ie72b65b6be224cadc8730e050bec38d2face5dfd
Closes-bug: #1474059
(cherry picked from commit c11b0408ef0f2d98749106cabc47c7d0b9268b4c)

commit_message:
Allowing job binary objects to be updated

Job Binary objects can now be updated as long as they
are not referenced by an active job in the PENDING state.

Change-Id: I9e1559e3ab5ff07557f284ae59bb8161591b6e6c
Implements: bp edp-edit-job-binaries

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 406, 'name': 'Mike Scherbakov', 'email': 'mihgen@gmail.com', 'username': 'mihgen'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 14543, 'name': 'Maciej Kwiek', 'email': 'mkwiek@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mkwiek'}]
commit_message:
Add project fuel-nailgun-agent repo

Before this we kept node discovery agent
in stackforge/fuel-web repo:

* https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-web/blob/master/bin/agent
* https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-web/blob/master/bin/nailgun-agent.cron

I am suggesting to move it because:

* written on Ruby instead of Python;
* installed on nodes unlike Nailgun;
* it is client for Nailgun API;
* need another core-reviewers team;
* need to be tested differently.

We kept changes history from fuel-web repository
Closes-Bug: #1473893

commit_message:
Allow blacklisting os-api extensions

Currently os-api extensions can only be disabled by choosing which
ones to enable. With nearly a hundred extensions, disabling a single
extension is absurdly onerous. This makes it possible to blacklist
extensions as well by adding a new osapi_compute_extension loader,
nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.exclude_extensions, which can be
used in concord with osapi_compute_ext_list to disable extensions.

This also adds unit tests for many of the extension loading bits.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1427838
Change-Id: I4d3047bb36e02cfda87749cb1225d7c2f851a7fa

commit_message:
Move disk UUID to BDM

The vSCSI volume connector requires that the disk UUID be saved on the
instance so that it can be discovered correctly for the removal
operation.  This had been done on the instance's system metadata.  This
change set moves it onto the BDM.

Change-Id: I8a242a3397e04757a5551c22b03017f095f34625
Closes-Bug: 1471847

commit_message:
Adding Kuryr as a part of neutron big stadium.

Kuryr aims to service the Docker Container Network Model[1]  by leveraging
Neutron in a way similar to how Nova does.

The project will serve as a single effort point for connecting
the various Neutron sub projects with Dockers and provide
different Docker plumbing (connecting the docker instances into
the overlay) images for the various different Neutron plugins
and implementations

[1] https://github.com/docker/docker/blob/master/experimental/networking.md

Change-Id: I38f24906493e25575b084b06b7a62bbfc0c2f414

commit_message:
Policy Based Modification of Environment

Goal is to be able to define modification of an environment by Congress policies prior
deployment. This allows to add components (for example monitoring), change/set properties
(for example to enforce given zone, flavors, ...) and relationships into environment,
so modified environment is after that deployed.

Change-Id: I37d7dbfad351e42c89db2d5fd82d4f08581a040c

subject: Fix set_default() when used before config init
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 14:56:36.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py'], 'message': 'Fix set_default() when used before config init

Using set_default() before initializing OpenStackConfig would cause
an error since the _defaults dict would still be None and not an
actual dict. This corrects that by calling get_defaults() to make
sure it is initialized properly, and also adds a warning to note
that the method is now deprecated.

Change-Id: I81803c680b614f9bee47c6f69a4efffa638dcebc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix set_default() when used before config init

Using set_default() before initializing OpenStackConfig would cause
an error since the _defaults dict would still be None and not an
actual dict. This corrects that by calling get_defaults() to make
sure it is initialized properly, and also adds a warning to note
that the method is now deprecated.

Change-Id: I81803c680b614f9bee47c6f69a4efffa638dcebc

commit_message:
Node list sorting and filtering

* added sorting controls to node management panel
* added filter controls to node management panel
* changed simple text filtering control to check
  node IP address also
* user filtering and sorting selection is saved
  in Nailgun DB. Search input value is also saved.

Blueprint node-list-sorters-and-filters

Change-Id: I4651c04d6e42fa2a0d661267a90eae94d5af2f5f

subject: Raise minimum python-openstackclient to 1.4.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-08 23:24:33.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Raise minimum python-openstackclient to 1.4.0

OSC commit 224d375ef4120998dc51fbf55f1778d1ccf118a0 added the --wait
option to the `openstack server delete` command which we want to use in
grenade, so we need to raise the minimum required version to 1.4.0.

We won't be able to actually use --wait in grenade until the M release
where stable/liberty would have this minimum required version for the
option.

Related grenade change: I16981765c12db7145f7c4754d454431afb6d5cbb

Related-Bug: #1460112

Change-Id: If488b664cb4f137fdbbacf902d56912d5908aa3b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Raise minimum python-openstackclient to 1.4.0

OSC commit 224d375ef4120998dc51fbf55f1778d1ccf118a0 added the --wait
option to the `openstack server delete` command which we want to use in
grenade, so we need to raise the minimum required version to 1.4.0.

We won't be able to actually use --wait in grenade until the M release
where stable/liberty would have this minimum required version for the
option.

Related grenade change: I16981765c12db7145f7c4754d454431afb6d5cbb

Related-Bug: #1460112

Change-Id: If488b664cb4f137fdbbacf902d56912d5908aa3b

commit_message:
Don't change undisclosed param on slave-change

If use only one of --vcpu or --ram param in slave-change command,
      other param won't use default value and won't change VM

Change-Id: Ie1e37d1083a1f860d1b03d8c75af3500201c2f67
Closes-bug: #1464649

commit_message:
Disable instance with file creation if ceph is use

In kilo files injection is disabled if ceph is using,
so  that we need display tests only for
deployments without ceph

Change-Id: I6b1a1ff786b6452542a42b6032eb377eadb32021
Related-Bug: #1473164

commit_message:
Fix policy.json certificate_authority inconsistency

Change the certificate_authority add_to_project, remove_from_project,
and set_preferred entries to use rule:admin instead of role:admin. This
brings these entries into consistency with their neighbors.

Closes-Bug: #1473593
Change-Id: Ibdb7512cf751b92298e350dac1689b036a6fd023

commit_message:
Fix false positive result for file injection

Raise exception if 'False' is result of
command execution.
Also check if there is not 'ping' i the command raise
message different then "Instance connectivity issue"

Change-Id: I38bb7be403d73a262a33def79476fd844ae4c06d
Closes-Bug: #1473164

commit_message:
fuel-agent: use different md metadata version

0.90 will be used for centos only letting GRUB-legacy to boot.
Otherwise, default (1.2) will be used as GRUB2 is able to deal with it.

Change-Id: I89c5178d991970de4682c1e239e0ecb014ba61bd
Closes-Bug: #1430432

subject: Remove haproxy galera monitoring user
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-10 21:43:50.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': "Remove haproxy galera monitoring user

Prior to kilo, we created a static 'haproxy' MySQL user for haproxy.
In kilo and onwards, we now have a user variable called
galera_monitoring_user which defaults to monitoring.  This commit
updates scripts/run-upgrade.sh to remove the old haproxy user to
ensure we don't have a defunct MySQL user lying about.

Change-Id: I071596c4c6d881d5304fc49a7cf752d5489ee19b
Closes-Bug: #1472673
(cherry picked from commit c51aaaccac3fca5cc202c7784ecb9f7a9490d5d0)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove haproxy galera monitoring user

Prior to kilo, we created a static 'haproxy' MySQL user for haproxy.
In kilo and onwards, we now have a user variable called
galera_monitoring_user which defaults to monitoring.  This commit
updates scripts/run-upgrade.sh to remove the old haproxy user to
ensure we don't have a defunct MySQL user lying about.

Change-Id: I071596c4c6d881d5304fc49a7cf752d5489ee19b
Closes-Bug: #1472673
(cherry picked from commit c51aaaccac3fca5cc202c7784ecb9f7a9490d5d0)

commit_message:
Adding Angular Project Images Panel

This patch creates a blank Images panel in the project dashboard.

It follows the pattern established by the following merged commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190865/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190852/

Dependent patches will be added for:
 - index table
 - forms
 - actions

Change-Id: I2fe5492c3954aa8c1ed751d062d22f0fe8c5f3d1
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

subject: Allow galera wsrep_provider_options to be customised
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-22 17:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/cluster.cnf.j2', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow galera wsrep_provider_options to be customised

This patch introduces galera_wsrep_provider_options as a list of
options instead of only catering for changing the gcache.size
option. This allows the deployer to change any number of the
wsrep_provider_options available.

Note: The variable galera_gcache_size is respected in this patch
but if galera_wsrep_provider_options is customised by a deployer
then the custom list must include reference to galera_gcache_size
for it to be respected.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1464699
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <ian.cordasco@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I78a5a1d344729fdc06636b1c6dade63a7ba59e94
(cherry picked from commit 999fc102d11fc64d7140b87e1a246bb196b44f39)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow galera wsrep_provider_options to be customised

This patch introduces galera_wsrep_provider_options as a list of
options instead of only catering for changing the gcache.size
option. This allows the deployer to change any number of the
wsrep_provider_options available.

Note: The variable galera_gcache_size is respected in this patch
but if galera_wsrep_provider_options is customised by a deployer
then the custom list must include reference to galera_gcache_size
for it to be respected.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1464699
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <ian.cordasco@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I78a5a1d344729fdc06636b1c6dade63a7ba59e94
(cherry picked from commit 999fc102d11fc64d7140b87e1a246bb196b44f39)

subject: Add role system-crontab-coordination
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 14:09:08.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rsyslog-install.yml', 'playbooks/galera-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/system_crontab_coordination/README.md', 'playbooks/roles/system_crontab_coordination/LICENSE', 'playbooks/os-heat-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-swift-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/system_crontab_coordination/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/memcached-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-horizon-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-tempest-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/system_crontab_coordination/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/system_crontab_coordination/meta/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/system_crontab_coordination/templates/crontab.j2'], 'message': 'Add role system-crontab-coordination

Currently every host, both containers and bare metal, has a crontab
configured with the same values for minute, hour, day of week etc. This
means that there is the potential for a service interruption if, for
example, a cron job were to cause a service to restart.

This commit adds a new role which attempts to adjust the times defined
in the entries in the default /etc/crontab to reduce the overlap
between hosts.

Change-Id: I18bf0ac0c0610283a19c40c448ac8b6b4c8fd8f5
Closes-bug: #1424705
(cherry picked from commit e148635e789568a2c886c3a669884bd0d82d9a72)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add role system-crontab-coordination

Currently every host, both containers and bare metal, has a crontab
configured with the same values for minute, hour, day of week etc. This
means that there is the potential for a service interruption if, for
example, a cron job were to cause a service to restart.

This commit adds a new role which attempts to adjust the times defined
in the entries in the default /etc/crontab to reduce the overlap
between hosts.

Change-Id: I18bf0ac0c0610283a19c40c448ac8b6b4c8fd8f5
Closes-bug: #1424705
(cherry picked from commit e148635e789568a2c886c3a669884bd0d82d9a72)

commit_message:
Fixing mistral resources path

 * Fixed standard actions and workflows paths.
   If mistral is installed in system, 'resources'
   are not copied to dist-packages/mistral, so
   mistral-db-manage populate command won't work.
   Now resources are included in mistral.

Closes-Bug: #1457842

Change-Id: I3149867e615acd188691b299a051e7458e2eb386
(cherry picked from commit 4e699ce21b467cae3000cebfa3b4c2cdbfc05441)

commit_message:
Always use gate- instead of check (akanda, ceilometer)

Remove extra pipeline parameter and only use "gate", we do not need the
differentiation between check and gate anymore.

Change-Id: Id6e8074d81759285b6acb957343123dd306f43e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 19:14:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use an Anchor when service is managed

Today, Keystone resources (domains, tenants, etc) are created only if
'keystone' service is started.
When running Keystone in WSGI, the autorequire is broken for those
resources.
Adding 'httpd' in autorequire is not enough because it could fail to
orchestration issues if running another httpd resource (Horizon) that
depends on having Keystone started.

This patch is about to create an Anchor (keystone_started) in
keystone::service that require Service['keystone'] resource to be
created.
In resource types, change the autorequire to depend on the new Anchor.

With that patch, we are sure Keystone resources won't be created before
service is actually managed (running or stopped) and other resources
(Horizon, using httpd server) can also depend on this Anchor if needed.

Change-Id: Ie72b65b6be224cadc8730e050bec38d2face5dfd
Closes-bug: #1474059

commit_message:
Use an Anchor when service is managed

Today, Keystone resources (domains, tenants, etc) are created only if
'keystone' service is started.
When running Keystone in WSGI, the autorequire is broken for those
resources.
Adding 'httpd' in autorequire is not enough because it could fail to
orchestration issues if running another httpd resource (Horizon) that
depends on having Keystone started.

This patch is about to create an Anchor (keystone_started) in
keystone::service that require Service['keystone'] resource to be
created.
In resource types, change the autorequire to depend on the new Anchor.

With that patch, we are sure Keystone resources won't be created before
service is actually managed (running or stopped) and other resources
(Horizon, using httpd server) can also depend on this Anchor if needed.

Change-Id: Ie72b65b6be224cadc8730e050bec38d2face5dfd
Closes-bug: #1474059

commit_message:
Remove usage of dict.iterkeys()

Replace "for key in dict.iterkeys()" with "for key in dict"; make
congress python-3 compatible

Change-Id: Id2478fc6e315d0742909d54dbc15adbc9ba41b0f
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-python3

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Smart-Table Client Side Magic Search

Directives to allow use of Magic Search with Smart-Table.
Only client side filtering is available in this patch.

Current implemented in the "Select Soure" step in the
Launch Instane workflow. Implementation in other steps
to follow.

Tests to follow also.

Co-Authored-By: Randy Bertram <rbertram@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Sahlin <asahlin@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I94fd4c1ebe4e791b30146863c4a06843b4e70dcb
Closes-Bug: #1434710

commit_message:
bump python-openstack client to 1.5.0

python-openstackclient 1.0.3 does not work with master because there
is a massive set of conflicts between master requirements and the
capped requirements on the 1.0.x branch. Bump to the latest release to
reflect something closer to reality.

Change-Id: I6e4a22df38ceb82a85a7156bb2236c559002de17

subject: Don't modify exception formatting strings
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 01:21:42.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': "Don't modify exception formatting strings

When we received a remote exception from a nested stack, we were modifying
the formatting string of the exception's class in the mistaken belief that
copy.copy() makes copies of classes. Use a subclass instead, so that future
exceptions of the same type raised locally use the correct formatting string.

Change-Id: I43fcce4758848f6388b9d6da68a121c04a68f5cb
Closes-Bug: #1474153
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't modify exception formatting strings

When we received a remote exception from a nested stack, we were modifying
the formatting string of the exception's class in the mistaken belief that
copy.copy() makes copies of classes. Use a subclass instead, so that future
exceptions of the same type raised locally use the correct formatting string.

Change-Id: I43fcce4758848f6388b9d6da68a121c04a68f5cb
Closes-Bug: #1474153

subject: fuel-agent: do not use lazy umount
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 16:57:51.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/manager.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_fs_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'fuel-agent: do not use lazy umount

Using "umount -l" is a potentially dangerous act as
fuel-agent doesn't wait until any process stops using files
on that mounted fs.

Use of lazy umount should be disabled by default.
In case if regular umount failed,
it means abnormal sutiation where manual intervention is needed as
lazy umount couldn't sort out the issue by itself.

Change-Id: If258535c43402142a8dcad0c87bc519fcc6904d2
Closes-Bug: #1454366
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fuel-agent: do not use lazy umount

Using "umount -l" is a potentially dangerous act as
fuel-agent doesn't wait until any process stops using files
on that mounted fs.

Use of lazy umount should be disabled by default.
In case if regular umount failed,
it means abnormal sutiation where manual intervention is needed as
lazy umount couldn't sort out the issue by itself.

Change-Id: If258535c43402142a8dcad0c87bc519fcc6904d2
Closes-Bug: #1454366

Change-Id: I3c718ece6643fe932cb45bf5baea620c5c8a9408
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-03 12:26:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Multi-region swift

A Swift cluster can be deployed in such a way that the cluster spans
multiple geographically dispersed data centers. This allows an end-user
to ensure resiliency in the event of a data center failure, with one or
more copies of an object stored in each data center location. This
facilitates end-users being able to build out geographically dispersed
infrastructure, enabling high availability.

Implements: blueprint multi-region-swift

commit_message:
Multi-region swift

A Swift cluster can be deployed in such a way that the cluster spans
multiple geographically dispersed data centers. This allows an end-user
to ensure resiliency in the event of a data center failure, with one or
more copies of an object stored in each data center location. This
facilitates end-users being able to build out geographically dispersed
infrastructure, enabling high availability.

Implements: blueprint multi-region-swift
Change-Id: I3c718ece6643fe932cb45bf5baea620c5c8a9408

subject: Correct node override for experimental bindep job
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-10 19:43:04.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/openstack_functions.py'], 'message': 'Correct node override for experimental bindep job

This job doesn't have "dsvm" in the name, so zuul is calling
default_params_trusty() on it rather than devstack-params(). Correct
the functions to match this expectation.

Change-Id: I25e0e638d3d0dc1be66dfc8e17712ca995aa3a3a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct node override for experimental bindep job

This job doesn't have "dsvm" in the name, so zuul is calling
default_params_trusty() on it rather than devstack-params(). Correct
the functions to match this expectation.

Change-Id: I25e0e638d3d0dc1be66dfc8e17712ca995aa3a3a

subject: Add tool for reporting Bandit OpenStack coverage
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 8119, 'name': 'Eric Brown', 'email': 'browne@vmware.com', 'username': 'ericwb'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-10 05:47:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add tool for reporting Bandit OpenStack coverage

This script is intended for inclusion in the Bandit repository and usage
by the Bandit and other OpenStack teams.  It is not intended for inclusion
in Bandit packages / distribution.

It executes against Jenkins and Zuul configuration files in the
openstack-infra/project-config repository, parses out Bandit jobs
and tests, and prints a summary of results.

Change-Id: I2d133146223a6b185347662b47cc2bd6355a0900
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-11 01:36:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add tool for reporting Bandit OpenStack coverage

This script is intended for inclusion in the Bandit repository and usage
by the Bandit and other OpenStack teams.  It is not intended for inclusion
in Bandit packages / distribution.

It executes against Jenkins and Zuul configuration files in the
openstack-infra/project-config repository, parses out Bandit jobs
and tests, and prints a summary of results.

commit_message:
Add tool for reporting Bandit OpenStack coverage

This script is intended for inclusion in the Bandit repository and usage
by the Bandit and other OpenStack teams.  It is not intended for inclusion
in Bandit packages / distribution.

It executes against Jenkins and Zuul configuration files in the
openstack-infra/project-config repository, parses out Bandit jobs
and tests, and prints a summary of results.

It includes definition of an openstack_coverage testenv in tox.ini with
basic PyYAML and request dependencies to allow easy venv creation and
script execution.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I2d133146223a6b185347662b47cc2bd6355a0900

commit_message:
Make gate-keystone-python34 voting and add gate

Make the gate-keystone-python34 check job voting. Add also a voting
gate-keystone-python34 gate job by using the python3-jobs template.

The python34 job now pass, it's time to make it voting to avoid Python 3
regressions.

Change-Id: I51c18bc98bb5943d4c712c96216a12ee496783d4

subject: Add log rotation for docker containers
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-30 16:10:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add log rotation for docker containers

Run a cronjob which executes a command like:

  dockerctl shell CONTAINER logrotate /etc/logrotate.conf

This will allow logrotate to reload needed services using configs
shipped with the packages.

We aslo need to remove "rsyslog" and "nginx" packages from
containers that use "nailgun::packages" class to avoid logrotate
duplication. So we create a new class "nailgun::common" and use it
in our $service-only.pp manifests instead of "nailgun::packages"

commit_message:
Add log rotation for docker containers

Run a cronjob which executes a command like:

  dockerctl shell CONTAINER logrotate /etc/logrotate.conf

This will allow logrotate to reload needed services using configs
shipped with the packages.

We aslo need to remove "rsyslog" and "nginx" packages from
containers that use "nailgun::packages" class to avoid logrotate
duplication. So we create a new class "nailgun::common" and use it
in our $service-only.pp manifests instead of "nailgun::packages"

Change-Id: Ic625e086db7bcd3622bce73ec4cec0dd6f81121d

commit_message:
Disable coredumps for centos by default

We do not ship debuginfo packages so debugging coredumps is not
very usefull anyway. If cloud operator/administrator wants to get
and analyze coredumps, he can easily enable them back at any time.
Uncontrolled coredump generation may lead to "disk full" errors
and thus break a lot of services and data.

poke ci
Change-Id: I57efc51bb81d930614e4651c8d056512b3e24275
Closes-bug: #1253577

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-07 01:28:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Merge availability_zone tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges availability_zone functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.
Also enabling some required extension for v2 tests.

commit_message:
Merge availability_zone tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges availability_zone functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.
Also enabling some required extension for v2 tests.

Change-Id: I82e7011da212cb4699c4c19b95523a54a6c2f259

commit_message:
Add image while launching instance from image(create new volumn)

In legacy launch instance, when launching instance from
image(create new volumn), we can not see image name in
instance table, the patch fix it.

Change-Id: I1b63dd739b60a1141d1666f06763eea6c056743d
Closes-Bug: #1460584

commit_message:
Add dependency on nodepool-base to node-devstack

The build for node-devstack will fail because of missing scripts unless
nodepool-base is executed before, so add this as dependency.

Change-Id: Iabc06a542529500ad248ae067beed9639d24e506

commit_message:
Ability to auto generate the filesystem store metadata file

After this path has been merged : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190265/
The compute service has the ability to copy the image data from the mountpoint
directly which can save image download time.

This patch make the metadata file can be generated automatically if user
specify the id and mountpoint.

Change-Id: Ibd4cc2d15a97f8018fc7f0aa19e4f2c9d1da285c

This specification discusses the issue of database schema
migrations which may proceed while allowing both the previous
and the updated version of the Neutron database API to run

larger approach which is to allow a Neutron application

while the database schema is migrated.

commit_message:
Propose scripted online schema migrations

This specification discusses the issue of database schema
migrations which may proceed while allowing both the previous
and the updated version of the Neutron database API to run
against that schema at the same time.  This is part of a
larger approach which is to allow a Neutron application
to be upgraded to a new version without incurring downtime
while the database schema is migrated.

Change-Id: Ib27c6eb8c901536f1f30d0911dedd4db13d76e9f

commit_message:
[Reports] Add class for merging data stream

This patch adds class rally.task.processing.utils.GraphZiper
that can process unlimited stream of some values (assume
that is a kind of iteration value) and compose a result list
with expected length.

This is useful for processing data for reports charts, so we
can process arbitrary count of iterations without memory load
and generate effective chart for these iterations.

Change-Id: Iec28b26fcbeb8523bb0b01cf0723be37c76f0127

commit_message:
Add processing of keep_data flag

In case when some partition has keep_data = True
need to elevate flag to file system level and
do not to create new partition table. Do not clean
file system when it has keep_data = True.
There should not be a problem if some raw data
will not be cleaned.

Change-Id: I9e67e4b7f9421d517e360e403fa89ea8ca9f43b8
Implements: blueprint partition-preservation

commit_message:
Fix test failures caused by mock update

Python's mock library had an update that exposed issues with tests not calling
real assert methods.  Before the update mock allowed any method to be called,
real or not real.  After the update mock is only allowing real methods to be
called.

Change-Id: I4188e6a71353ffbd13e467f0c1c6502d53483caf

commit_message:
Remove .mailmap

Specs repositories are not published to pypi, so there's no need to
maintain a .mailmap file. Remove it.

Change-Id: Iee394e791451e0a88feaf19ddd4a816b84eb83a7

commit_message:
Cluster Scaling

Introduces new ReST API for cluster grow and cluster shrink.  Also
outlines changes to the python and CLI components to reflect
the new operations.

Change-Id: I6e2b8b1c96c2d5e667f5aaf7d017428805ce8136
Implements: blueprint cluster-scaling

commit_message:
Rework RST building

Use the same shell scripts like openstack-manuals for building of RST
files. This simplifies the tox.ini file and allows easier adding of new
tags.

This now build dotnet, fog, and pkgcloud versions as draft documents and
continues to publish the libcloud version.

Change-Id: Id5deebbb54904a44691104e19ef60f15a14c0f7c

commit_message:
Libvirt: Define system_family for libvirt guests

Set the system_family property of guests to "Virtual Machine". Without
this patch the processor family in the virtual bios is undefined. The
string "Virtual Machine" is chosen for parity with VMWare.

Change-Id: I856b905992f62fa653dfe3971bf83351309d7bda

commit_message:
libvirt: configuration for interface driver options

Currently, the configuration element of the interface
doesn't support any driver related options.

Adding an option to add vhost queues to the configuration:
    <interface type="ethernet">
      <mac address="DE:AD:BE:EF:CA:FE"/>
      <model type="virtio"/>
      <driver name="vhost" queues="4"/>
      <target dev="vnet0"/>
    </interface>

Partially implements blueprint libvirt-virtio-net-multiqueue
Change-Id: Ie27744c9f1c24ba4bbb7477fe644926844d5eaf5

commit_message:
--fuel-version return data to stderr instead of stdout

Version output generated via the
**'version' action** of the **argparse** module
is routed to stderr.

Details: http://bugs.python.org/issue18920

Change-Id: I56e72946d494310cf412c6b3dbc4617382c6e465
Closes-Bug: #1393849

commit_message:
Add simple data driver for partitioning info

This new "simple" data driver takes serialized partitioning info
that is provided before provisioning from external tool.
It does not make any calculations for that data and expect it to have
all required informations about partitioning.
Other changes:
* added unittest2 to use some of it features
* added requests_mock to mock http requests
* added objects conversion to/from dictionary to make serialization
  easier
* added a common "interface" for data drivers
* fixed test for "do_build_image" - now a correct data driver is used

Change-Id: If0c60073f9565584ed81fb9e0b620bd76a251c01
Implements: blueprint volume-manager-refactoring

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 07:00:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the unmapped locale from zanata.xml

We map all locales that contain a _ so that they map correctly to the
locale present on the Zanata server. While testing the pull
functionality, it turns out the client throws a traceback if there are
duplicate locales, so remove the existing one when adding a mapped one.

Change-Id: I9fc8df1996a5229bfef8e35f6d2fe62b06f6d01a
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-14 08:29:30.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/ZanataUtils.py'], 'message': 'Directly edit the unmapped locale from zanata.xml

We map all locales that contain a _ so that they map correctly to the
locale present on the Zanata server. While testing the pull
functionality, it turns out the client throws a traceback if there are
duplicate locales, so just edit the existing locale element, rather
than adding potential duplicates.

Change-Id: I9fc8df1996a5229bfef8e35f6d2fe62b06f6d01a
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Directly edit the unmapped locale from zanata.xml

We map all locales that contain a _ so that they map correctly to the
locale present on the Zanata server. While testing the pull
functionality, it turns out the client throws a traceback if there are
duplicate locales, so just edit the existing locale element, rather
than adding potential duplicates.

Change-Id: I9fc8df1996a5229bfef8e35f6d2fe62b06f6d01a

commit_message:
Merge server password tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges server password functional tests.
Previously there was no functional tests of server password in v2.1.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: Ibdc443c1274c26b6816639f37e72725f1487454f

commit_message:
Convert RabbitMQ active/active doc to RST

I did not convert the active/passive doc as I believe that
is being deprecated.

Added $ for root cmd prompt due to formatting issues.
Added closing square bracket for cluster_status cmd.
Moved last note directive to reduce text size.

commit_message:
Allow deploying a subset of controllers

Since a primary controlles is now stored in the database
it should be safe to allow re-deploying controllers separately.

Change-Id: I7bbb110086897e7c9834b2521b580e49df65d83a
Closes-bug: #1470800

commit_message:
Convert Cinder HA doc to RST

This converts the existing documentation about implementing
high availability for Cinder to RST.  It includes some minor
editorial changes but no content enhancements.

This content needs to be updated and expanded after the conversion
is completed.

Also, disable D000 doc8 check since it does not handle the lineos
directive. This is the same fix that was done for openstack-manuals.

Change-Id: I87e18696d5e18833361cfad0c50d20bff616d74f

commit_message:
cloud-admin-guide-rst: Rework orchestration layout

Remove hidden toctree and use a normal toctree.
Split up introduction into separate file.

This renders the content now on several separate files instead of one
very large file.

Compare the new output with:
http://docs.openstack.org/draft/admin-guide-cloud-rst/orchestration.html
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/ch_admin-openstack-orchestration.html

Change-Id: Iff95d2d83abc1ef95bed5cd70b114a9724bdc57f

commit_message:
Always use gate- instead of check- (l-n*)

Change pipeline name to only use "gate", we do not need the
differentiation between check and gate anymore.
This changes the pipelines configured via files in jenkins/jobs/[l-n]*.

Change-Id: Ifdd228a918fa69ab7f6151e45f32e468fef4e490

commit_message:
Implementation of dynamically reloadable pipeline

Adds the ability to poll the file-based pipeline
configuration and use it to activate/deactivate
collection targets on-the-fly.

Change-Id: I93fa33a167db81bb8a891d668c0714e627214d11
Partially-Implements: blueprint reload-file-based-pipeline-configuration

commit_message:
Close temporary files in virt/disk/test_api.py

Add self.addCleanup(imgfile.close) to automatically close the temporary
created file.

This change fixes sporadic OSError errors at exit:

Exception OSError: (2, 'No such file or directory', ...) in <bound
method _TemporaryFileWrapper.__del__ of <closed file ...> ignored

Change-Id: Ib792bc6fb7c62adbdfc0697e64c7d795cd0a3b15

commit_message:
Cleanup the build directories earlier

Split the cleanup_dirs function in two, i.e. cleanup of the build dir
and the image dir, and use the former to cleanup the temporary build
subdirs after their unmount, before the conversion to other disk
formats; they are not needed anyway at that point, and allows to save
disk space during the conversion phase.

Change-Id: Ie30d7e6033613d6979148423326ae7e17a7342e7

commit_message:
tox.ini: Create py34 no-op target

This is a quick workaround for py34 job failure
until the more appropriate fix [1] is merged.
We want to merge some urgent patches.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201424/

Change-Id: I5a10e7d122ba047469ae068e44e190ea2e16668b

commit_message:
(WIP) Always configure mongo with replica set

WORK IN PROGRESS

- Configure mongodb replicaset for any number of nodes. This will
  allow us to add mongodb nodes.
- Use 'mongodb_replset' custom resource to setup and update
  replica set.
- Update 'mongodb_replset' custom resource to support
  authentication.
- Always setup authentication, user, db first, then replica.

Change-Id: I1f7d3ddd21a854670c88cc689bf176d3b054898c
Partial-bug: #1308990

commit_message:
Replace mox with mox3

mox doesn't work on Python 3, whereas mox3 works on Python 2 and Python
3. Cinder, Nova and many other projects already replaced mox with mox3.
mox3 is now maintained by OpenStack.

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: I10e6a9754ebd58a2640d73ec8966527c3aa1fe9a

commit_message:
Add check-ironic-inspector-dsvm-nv to ironic experimental pipeline

Inspection is an Ironic driver interface introduced in Kilo release,
and ironic inspector project provides a generic implementation of it.
Right now there is no gate testing of inspection on ironic tree.

This job validates inspection using both ironic and ironic inspector
API, so it's useful to run on ironic tree as well.

This patch adds it to the experimental pipeline, so that we can make
sure it works before proposing it as non-voting check job to ironic.

Change-Id: I9f70cd94447a395be48991ee456fa64923286117

commit_message:
Allow providing and using a 'nested_start_state_fetcher'

For hierarchical machines it seems like it would be
quite useful to allow nested machines to initialize to
states that are not just none so to enable this allow for
providing a callback that will be used to determine the
callback for all nested machines (and nested-nested
machines) so that they can be initialized to the users
desire.

Change-Id: I45a0c0e0c2a976e0df094e6c728f943766be7c7a

commit_message:
EMC VNX: Fix the total capacity for dynamic Pool

For the pools that are not dynamic, the total capacity of the pool returns
as total size of all members of the pool; For the pools that are dynamic,
it returns the potential, maximum total size, in other words the total size
of all members plus the space available for the pool extension.

Change-Id: Ie093a9ebcda7ca77906efe3786ee585b836c6a52
Closes-bug: 1464136

commit_message:
Fix the unit tests with wrong usage of mock

Replace assert_called_twice with self.assertEqual(2, <...>.call_count).
Replace assert_called_once() with self.assertEqual(1, <...>.call_count).
Use a list of calls for the assert_has_calls function.

Also updates mock requirement, to match global requirements for kilo

Closes-Bug: #1473369
Co-Author: Victor Ryzhenkin <vryzhenkin@mirantis.com>
Co-Author: Sergey Vilgelm <svilgelm@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Kill rsync/scp processes before deleting instance

In the resize operation, during copying files from source to
destination compute node scp/rsync processes are not aborted after
the instance is deleted because linux kernel doesn't delete instance
files physically until all processes using the file handle is closed
completely. Hence rsync/scp process keeps on running until it
transfers 100% of file data.

Added callback method to execute call which will store the pid of
scp/rsync process in cache as a key: value pair which will be used to
kill the process if it is running while deleting the instance. Instance
uuid is used as a key in the cache and pid will be the value.

SecurityImpact

Co-authored-by: Nikola Đipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1387543
Change-Id: Ia0302ec43f96512c2e51a307c3091a2cee066610

commit_message:
Sync ApacheHttpServer app with apps.openstack.org

The package with Apache Http Server hosted at apps.openstack.org was
modified  at some point to include IP address reporting and list of
dependent images. That change was never put into this repository.

This patch synchronizes the state of the package.

Change-Id: Ib44496bba5a081cc363becc84e898c24ad43f3a2

subject: Use the warn_eventlet_not_patched util function
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 23:33:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_executors/impl_eventlet.py'], 'message': 'Use the warn_eventlet_not_patched util function

This code can share the check for eventlet and warn
when the thread module is not patched (which will be
a problem).

When it is not patched the following warning gets
emitted:

"RuntimeWarning: It is highly recommended that when eventlet"
" is used that the ['thread'] modules are monkey patched when"
" using the 'oslo.messaging eventlet executor' (to avoid spurious"
" or unexpected lock-ups and/or hangs)"

This will not be needed once a new futurist release happens
but until then standardize on using that util library to emit
these warnings.

Change-Id: I7277fe19a73d8094a0acf033c75dc881e0d1e533
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use the warn_eventlet_not_patched util function

This code can share the check for eventlet and warn
when the thread module is not patched (which will be
a problem).

When it is not patched the following warning gets
emitted:

"RuntimeWarning: It is highly recommended that when eventlet"
" is used that the ['thread'] modules are monkey patched when"
" using the 'oslo.messaging eventlet executor' (to avoid spurious"
" or unexpected lock-ups and/or hangs)"

This will not be needed once a new futurist release happens
but until then standardize on using that util library to emit
these warnings.

Change-Id: I7277fe19a73d8094a0acf033c75dc881e0d1e533

commit_message:
Fixing mistral resources path

 * Fixed standard actions and workflows paths.
   If mistral is installed in system, 'resources'
   are not copied to dist-packages/mistral, so
   mistral-db-manage populate command won't work.
   Now resources are included in mistral.

Closes-Bug: #1457842

Change-Id: I3149867e615acd188691b299a051e7458e2eb386

commit_message:
Pass all logging messages as strings

  For unification and easier migration to unicode in the future, all messages
  are passed as str object.

Change-Id: I687df762ea450b33aeaca37983694281ffa6f0d4
Closes-bug: #1394170

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-03-20 07:47:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correct DHCP port deletion when updating subnet

When setting enable_dhcp parameter of subnet to False,
Error will be reported to q-dhcp.log continually,
Also, dhcp port will not be deleted properly from port-list.
This is due to the following logic miss:
    1) Not all of the fixed IPs is used for dhcp ports; we have
       other kinds of ports.
    2) If we only update subnet when it is enabled for DHCP, we
       will never update the subnet when it is dis-enabled for DHCP.

Change-Id: Iebd2c7922978bec0ef154866f24319e899e3b88e
Closes-Bug: 1417379

commit_message:
When disabling dhcp, delete fixed ip properly

When setting enable_dhcp parameter of subnet to False, the fixed ip of
dhcp port of this subnet is not been removed.
Also a resync will be triggered.

Change-Id: Iebd2c7922978bec0ef154866f24319e899e3b88e
Closes-Bug: 1417379

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-01 08:43:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "dhcp fails if extra_dhcp_opts for stateless subnet enabled

vm on a network having IPv4 and IPv6 dhcpv6 stateless subnets,
fails to get IPv4 address, when vm uses a port with extra_dhcp_opts.

neutron creates entries in dhcp host file for each subnet of a port.
Each of these entries will have same mac address as first field,
and may have client_id, fqdn, ipv4/ipv6 address for dhcp/dhcpv6 stateful,
or tag as other fields.
For dhcpv6 stateless subnet with extra_dhcp_opts,
host file will have only mac address and tag.

If the last entry in host file for the port with extra_dhcp_opts,
is for dhcpv6 stateless subnet, then dnsmasq tries to use this entry,
(as dnsmasq reads the hosts file from EOF) to resolve
dhcp request even for IPv4, treats as 'no address found'
and fails to send DHCPOFFER.

So we sort the fixed_ips, so that ipv6 subnets for the port are added
first in host file, to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I3bea58d86a3508e49cbac1d03c6b640836b4a7a2
Closes-bug: #1466144
(cherry picked from commit 481d9a4f356d325e60e4c208c93693d755097bcd)

commit_message:
dhcp fails if extra_dhcp_opts for stateless subnet enabled

vm on a network having IPv4 and IPv6 dhcpv6 stateless subnets,
fails to get IPv4 address, when vm uses a port with extra_dhcp_opts.

neutron creates entries in dhcp host file for each subnet of a port.
Each of these entries will have same mac address as first field,
and may have client_id, fqdn, ipv4/ipv6 address for dhcp/dhcpv6 stateful,
or tag as other fields.
For dhcpv6 stateless subnet with extra_dhcp_opts,
host file will have only mac address and tag.

If the last entry in host file for the port with extra_dhcp_opts,
is for dhcpv6 stateless subnet, then dnsmasq tries to use this entry,
(as dnsmasq reads the hosts file from EOF) to resolve
dhcp request even for IPv4, treats as 'no address found'
and fails to send DHCPOFFER.

So we sort the fixed_ips, so that ipv6 subnets for the port are added
first in host file, to avoid this issue.

Kilo changes:
- test is modified not to include metadata IP static routes since the
  patch that introduced them in Liberty is not present in Kilo.

Change-Id: I3bea58d86a3508e49cbac1d03c6b640836b4a7a2
Closes-bug: #1466144
(cherry picked from commit 481d9a4f356d325e60e4c208c93693d755097bcd)

commit_message:
Revert "Remove useless db call instance_get_all_hung_in_rebooting"

We cannot remove remotable methods of Nova objects without a major
version bump.

This reverts commit ab19ed73aaf5c46f55f090ebbc41210c2e638edb.

Change-Id: I9053c816b56c7463264d9af7ee03b179a1a69595

commit_message:
Add project fuel-agent repo

This repository is for Fuel Agent (provisioning tool for Fuel).
We used to keep it https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-web/fuel_agent.
Now we need it to be placed in a separate repository because
we want it to be independent component with its own core
team and own release cycle.

Change-Id: I0b183171839557719544fa59acd35b284f49eb2f

At the section "exercising-the-services-using-devstack".

commit_message:
Fix filtering apps by category is broken

Div with id 'apps_carousel' will be hidden if a category with no apps belong to.
As a result, filtering apps by category would be broken then even if selete apps
with filter 'ALL'.

Change-Id: I3467c63555ffd50d25c1d1428ce3c481a0de31fc
Closes-Bug: #1454865

commit_message:
Squash docker images so they load faster

Added docker-squash as a new tool in build
process, which combines layers of Docker images
in order to make them smaller.

Change-Id: Ie2cf1203ffcb81104d3eee614731ab015084cdae
Related-Bug: #1333458

commit_message:
Qos Agent Extension

This patch introduces the following:
QosAgentExtension - implementation of AgentCoreResourceExtension
QosAgentDriver - interface class
This will allow any agent to implement their own low level driver for
Qos Agent Extension.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <mangelajo@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9e388173dfe0eb43c961018bd687bc86f34c7a6a

commit_message:
Use the pythonic way to catch exceptions

We shouldn't use the isinstance fucntion instead of except to determinate
the type of exceptions.

Closes-Bug: 1473614
Change-Id: I7882e68ea406c6c8b66a877072adf976171189ce

subject: Use constraints.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 04:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': 'Use constraints.

Without constraints a single test run can install different releases
vs the devstack core code, leading to inexplicable errors.

Change-Id: I9894a1d9371da1cab6e2c3b5102111c8dd6d14bc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use constraints.

Without constraints a single test run can install different releases
vs the devstack core code, leading to inexplicable errors.

Change-Id: I9894a1d9371da1cab6e2c3b5102111c8dd6d14bc

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.service

oslo.service has graduated, so murano should consume it.
Use the 1.16.0 version of the oslo.messaging library.

Change-Id: I774c70bdf06b304f7d958eac488dc28b7625fb12
Closes-Bug: #1466851
Depends-On: I4159450f54609c5185146472179d4299fe0c9d30
Depends-On: Ifa7a03b21aaf6911039c465696a0476e97905793

commit_message:
Use mock in test_attributes.py instead of mox

- remove unused VerifyAll, ReplayAll
- use MagicMock instead of CreateMockAnything
- use MagicMock object for returning value instead of lambda
  function

Change-Id: Ib3c531776fce4c450fd8679d11f3e693751d5db5

commit_message:
Add extra subnet route to ha router

Add scope in HA virtual route mode to
represent on link scope route from extra subnet.

Co-Authored-By: Assaf Muller <amuller@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6ce000a7aa8e4b9e61a35a86d3dc8c0b7beaa3a9
Closes-bug: 1414640

subject: neutron-server: Remove start/sleep/stop pattern
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 11:21:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron-server bootstrap: Use tcp_conn_validator

Currently the bootstrap of neutron-server (start/sleep/stop), sleep for
5 sec. On some cases it might not be enought as the neutron-server
hasn't finished to sync up. When neutron-server is running (ie. process
listening on port 9696) then it is suppose to mean that initialization
phase is over, hence we use tcp_conn_validator to stop until port 9696
is listening.

Change-Id: I894dc3305f7d6685ebcc6828e690c718a63f32bd
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201068/
Closes-Bug: #1473410
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-13 11:22:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron-server bootstrap: Use tcp_conn_validator

Currently the bootstrap of neutron-server (start/sleep/stop), sleep for
5 sec. On some cases it might not be enought as the neutron-server
hasn't finished to sync up. When neutron-server is running (ie. process
listening on port 9696) then it is suppose to mean that initialization
phase is over, hence we use tcp_conn_validator to stop until port 9696
is listening.

Change-Id: I894dc3305f7d6685ebcc6828e690c718a63f32bd
Depends-On: I1abf7a52a0696e392fdb85a8adca7ddcf81727b6
Closes-Bug: #1473410
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-07-13 14:14:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron-server: Remove start/sleep/stop pattern

Currently the bootstrap of the neutron server happens with the use of a
start/sleep/stop pattern. 5 sec being a random number, based on the
environment it can take longer and can lead to failure.

Since Pacemaker doesn't mind if the service is already started let
simply start the neutron server on the $pacemaker_master node.

Change-Id: I894dc3305f7d6685ebcc6828e690c718a63f32bd
Closes-Bug: #1473410
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-07-13 14:20:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron-server: Remove start/sleep/stop pattern

Currently the bootstrap of the neutron server happens with the use of a
start/sleep/stop pattern. 5 sec being a random number, based on the
environment it can take longer and can lead to failure.

Since Pacemaker doesn't mind if the service is already started let
simply start the neutron server on the $pacemaker_master node.

Change-Id: I894dc3305f7d6685ebcc6828e690c718a63f32bd
Closes-Bug: #1473410
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-07-13 14:22:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron-server: Remove start/sleep/stop pattern

Currently the bootstrap of the neutron server happens with the use of a
start/sleep/stop pattern. 5 sec being a random number, based on the
environment it can take longer and can lead to failure.

Since Pacemaker doesn't mind if the service is already started let
simply start the neutron server on the $pacemaker_master node.

Change-Id: I894dc3305f7d6685ebcc6828e690c718a63f32bd
Depends-On: I1abf7a52a0696e392fdb85a8adca7ddcf81727b6
Closes-Bug: #1473410
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-07-13 14:29:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron-server: Remove start/sleep/stop pattern

Currently the bootstrap of the neutron server happens with the use of a
start/sleep/stop pattern. 5 sec being a random number, based on the
environment it can take longer and can lead to failure.

Since Pacemaker doesn't mind if the service is already started let
simply start the neutron server on the $pacemaker_master node.

commit_message:
neutron-server: Remove start/sleep/stop pattern

Currently the bootstrap of the neutron server happens with the use of a
start/sleep/stop pattern.

Since Pacemaker doesn't mind if the service is already started let
simply start the neutron server on the $pacemaker_master node and wait
for 5 sec.

Change-Id: I894dc3305f7d6685ebcc6828e690c718a63f32bd
Closes-Bug: #1473410

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-07-10 09:35:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "SSL support for haproxy

This change adds support for SSL to the haproxy role. When
enabled, this implements/upgrades haproxy to v1.5.x from a PPA.

* A new boolean variable called 'haproxy_ssl' enables/disables
  the configuration of SSL for the haproxy service.

* A new variable called 'haproxy_ssl_self_signed_subject' has
  been implemented to allow the user to override the certificate
  properties, such as the CN and subjectAltName.

* A new variable called 'haproxy_cert_regen' has been
  implemented to allow the user to regenerate the self-signed
  certificate used for the SSL endpoint.

* SSL will only be enabled for a load balanced service if
  haproxy_ssl is true in the service vars. This has only been
  implemented for the Keystone service endpoints in this patch.

* The keystone admin service endpoint will only have SSL enabled
  if keystone_service_adminuri_proto == 'https'.

* The keystone internal/public service endpoint will only have
  SSL enabled if keystone_service_publicuri_proto == 'https'.

Implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: I069f1a0f928feb754816b7d450929fb62df66244

commit_message:
SSL support for haproxy

This change adds support for SSL to the haproxy role. When
enabled, this implements/upgrades haproxy to v1.5.x from a PPA.

* A new boolean variable called 'haproxy_ssl' enables/disables
  the configuration of SSL for the haproxy service.

* A new variable called 'haproxy_ssl_self_signed_subject' has
  been implemented to allow the user to override the certificate
  properties, such as the CN and subjectAltName.

* A new variable called 'haproxy_cert_regen' has been
  implemented to allow the user to regenerate the self-signed
  certificate used for the SSL endpoint.

* SSL will only be enabled for a load balanced service if
  haproxy_ssl is true in the service vars. This has only been
  implemented for the Keystone service endpoints in this patch.

* The keystone admin service endpoint will only have SSL enabled
  if keystone_service_adminuri_proto == 'https'.

* The keystone internal/public service endpoint will only have
  SSL enabled if keystone_service_publicuri_proto == 'https'.

Implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: I069f1a0f928feb754816b7d450929fb62df66244

commit_message:
Fix arg name for sort-dir

The argument name for sort-dir is now unified to be '-s', because '-d'
may cause confusion.

Change-Id: Ief0cb229546b565d58e428e1fd35c7d4e318018d

This patch enables cluster policy attach operation to use the default

'priority' parameter, we introduce a new configuration option and set it

commit_message:
Use policy defaults when not specified for attach

This patch enables cluster policy attach operation to use the default
'cooldown', 'level' from the policy object if not specified. For the
'priority' parameter, we introduce a new configuration option and set it
to 100. For 'enabled', we set the default to 'True'.

Change-Id: I3142773c9b4234bcf7dba43958a9d4b3cf9bdcea
Closes-Bug: 1465565

commit_message:
Don't copy exception classes

see:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9541025/how-to-copy-a-python-class
https://review.openstack.org/194487

This simplifies the method so it just re-raises local exceptions
and if it is Remote, raises ResourceFailure.

Closes-Bug: #1474153

Change-Id: I9c4dcadcbcf6abe6ff71dbcdccaae4706b684a83

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for reservation_expire

This patch removes the hard-code permission checks for db call
reservation_expire.

reservation_expire is only invoked in SchedulerManager. So there isn't
any REST API invoke it. So we can remove the hard-code permission directly.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: Ic872d5d03fb0859a738e4cf2691c94b3963eb0b7

commit_message:
Set vpn agent's agent_state['binary'] attribute

No vpn agent related information is shown when running
agent-list cmd, although it's enabled. Set vpn agent
binary attribute to remind admin user that the vpn agent
is active not the l3 agent.

Change-Id: I7fa58f9a5a94f7fe4381c994ae425154a2a1c1d8
Closes-Bug: #1472494

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-11 20:42:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names, and adds a hacking
check to prevent regressions.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names, and adds a hacking
check to prevent regressions.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I7137e7199f1cd6cdeacbc6c421d294f596e2ec0e

commit_message:
Use Custom networks as primary if no others exist

Modify the logic of primary network detection, so if the instance does
not join environment's default of flat networks, but some custom
networks are passed, the first of them is used as a primary one.

This fixes the issue when the floating ip address could not be assigned
in case of custom networking configuration.

Change-Id: Ief8819fd24695aceb118862839301b8045c41ea4
Closes-bug: #1474092

commit_message:
Wait until child process will be killed

It might take a wile to kill worker after receiving of sighup because
of worker can be busy at the time, so the check of the workers count
can be failed during some amount of time.
Add timeout for checking.

Change-Id: Ibdd29b07960b2f765b03ea9458b6e85cd6786fd0
Closes-bug: #1472531

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Sort metric data before grouping and processing

In gnocchi dispatcher, metric data will be grouped by resource_id and
counter_name before processing. But the inputted data is an unordered
list. It is better being sorted by resource_id and counter_name before
processing.

Change-Id: Id4f51adb60524a7b2bb08ef6cedd34f3d06f039a

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 scheduler_hints extension

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I7e54db52e55727f090128cc393a28043e1085636

commit_message:
Change 'tenant' to 'project' in test's preparation script

Because some CLI still use OS_TENANT_NAME we have both -
OS_TENANT_NAME and OS_PROJECT_NAME in script

Change-Id: I5e2585832fb15463b378fddda2f51c5e378d5de9

commit_message:
fix possible symlink attack with ansible

The commands used to create a temporary file on the localhost were
vulnerable to a symlink attack. Removing the shell module and ensuring
the ansible copy and file module is used will verify this file exists as a
file with the correct permissions and ownership

Change-Id: I829483edf1435e41726ebfe1bc826e0c2e5265e3
Closes-Bug: 1471376

commit_message:
Arista ML2 driver should ignore non-vlan networks

Arista ML2 Mech driver for VLANs presently does
not filter out non-vlan type networks (e.g vxlan).
This fix will simply ignore the request if a
non-vlan based network request is seen.

This patch is a juno port for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199380/8
The cherry-picking had to be done manually because of the decomposition
of the repository

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/arista/mechanism_arista.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/arista/test_mechanism_arista.py

Change-Id: I99ec5c5772a9f1f63cf871a98be50bdd2ba5db62
Closes-Bug: 1472458

commit_message:
Remove self.snat_ports, a dvr thing, from router base class

This was overlooked in splitting out dvr code from the router base
class.  It is dvr only.  Also, it doesn't need to be an instance
variable and was not use consistently.

commit_message:
Use identity V3 API for endpoint creation

Always use the keystone V3 API when creating services and endpoints. The syntax
here is slightly different but we maintain the function interface.

Change-Id: Ib3a375918a45fd6e37d873a1a5c0c4b26bdbb5d8
Implements: bp keystonev3

commit_message:
Pin mock below 1.1.0

The 1.1.0 release of mock library
exposed an issue in our tests and
the use of assert_any_calls.

For master we fixed up the tests, but
for stable, we want to just pin the
version.

Change is on its way through global req
process but hung up, trying to merge this
to get things moving again.

Change-Id: I74cc6600eb6049606c93613416962860745c6f35

commit_message:
Add future waiting helper module

This code is useful for waiting on green or regular futures
and ensuring this is done in a safe manner (both kinds can
not be waited at on the same time, due to how the locking
and event objects & strategies of both differ).

Depends-On: Ie491d8a504903fb27dcb9610567e660b86669126

Change-Id: I44ae2d260c1ecbdbd45b00b26113f9f1d64db5b6

Without explicitly setting the oslo.serialization requirements,
version 1.7.0 will be downloaded and used for UT. However,
stable/kilo does not support this version of oslo.

Change-Id: I30bc7f76b8bef4ffc1049f9eb8f71c4b3962e192
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization requirements

Without explicitly setting the oslo.serialization requirements,
version 1.7.0 will be downloaded and used for UT. However,
stable/kilo does not support this version of oslo.

Change-Id: I30bc7f76b8bef4ffc1049f9eb8f71c4b3962e192
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Arista ML2 driver should ignore non-vlan networks

Arista ML2 Mech driver for VLANs presently does
not filter out non-vlan type networks (e.g vxlan).
This fix will simply ignore the request if a
non-vlan based network request is seen.

Change-Id: I99ec5c5772a9f1f63cf871a98be50bdd2ba5db62
Closes-Bug: 1472458
(cherry picked from commit 581438a5b6dde5f161e1c129314a7bcaaae8da20)

subject: Use ostestr for test runs
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-29 15:31:19.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use ostestr for test runs

This commit switches to use ostestr for running tests. ostestr
integrates the subunit-trace output that other projects use for test

Change-Id: Ib5b5225b2a7bfb7897e1efe55181389d1ae095cb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use ostestr for test runs

This commit switches to use ostestr for running tests. ostestr
integrates the subunit-trace output that other projects use for test
output. (in addition to some other ui niceties)

Change-Id: Ib5b5225b2a7bfb7897e1efe55181389d1ae095cb

Add testcases for list_role_assignments of v3 domains

There are no unit testcases to cover list_role_assignments in
assignment_api.

Related-Bug: #1437407

commit_message:
Turn off oslo_conccurrency locking in volume driver

Since the volume driver is only accessed through one process, we
probably don't need concurrency locking.

Change-Id: I50f0cb4a7ef92a5fefe5fafb9f3ddadf0bf796b0
Closes-Bug: #1473535

commit_message:
Sort fields for consistency

test_save_updates_numa_topology seems to rely on the order of
the fields, specifically nova_object.changes list order breaks
the test intermittently.

Closes-Bug: #1473949
Change-Id: I2bf0a22d7b1621b3a5776ca29a02be7e3d4c01b9

commit_message:
Make `boot_runcommand_delete' accept command-dict

Make command-executing scenario `boot_runcommand_delete' accepting
command-specifying dict as input. Now `boot_runcommand_delete' is
able to execute a remote command, script from a local file
or inlined one.

Change-Id: I23308922ebae410b1682571c4f114c8080280b19
Implements: blueprint vm-workloads-framework

commit_message:
Change neutron command to validate token

Currently neutron_client.get_auth_info is being used just returns hash
of authentication. Changing command to list_networks to fix this

Closes-bug: #1442203

commit_message:
Fix iso-image-create to work on RedHat distros

- RedHat distros keep isolinux.bin at /usr/share/syslinux
- Do not use /usr/lib/syslinux blindly
Closes-Bug: #1472379

Change-Id: I2d58913090f2d35cc6446cf769b1f6618f29f849

commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup - Include angular plugin for auth js

Enable the angular-eslint plugin on the horizon/static/auth
so that 'npm run lint' continues to work. It broke recently
as the plugin was removed but the rules kept.

It also removes setup of the old rules.

subject: Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 23:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/tests.py'], 'message': "Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b
(cherry picked from commit 5c4e827568be429ac5227a950c9f24c578ca8fd8)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b
(cherry picked from commit 5c4e827568be429ac5227a950c9f24c578ca8fd8)

commit_message:
Use __iter__ method of Attributes class in __repr__ method

Join method expects list, but six.itervalues(self._attributes)  returns
a Attribute instance, so we should use own __iter__ method for building
list of values.

Closes-Bug: #1473974

Change-Id: I7c5d4a5a8d0142156c3416347940b9e90ed8df5c

commit_message:
Remove 3.3 & 2.6 classifier

so we should remove listing them as being supported.

commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup-style guide cleanup for filters.js

Use angular's isString function rather than using a typeof comparison.
Separate filter registrations from filter module declaration. Use $inject to
inject i18n dependency.

Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

commit_message:
Properly decode body before calling json.loads()

This commit fixes an issue when running the rest client and token
clients on python 3. httplib2 sets the type for the response body as
'bytes' when running on python 3, which requires that it be decoded
prior to running json.loads() on it. Additionally, in the v2 token
client a type check was done on the response body which was no longer
evaluating true because the type was no longer a 'str'. This was
fixed as part of the broader cleanup.

Change-Id: If4d496c4f10cec7d7050afc4b07f1f263de4c3e5

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-13 21:12:49.000000000', 'files': ['tools/simulator.py', 'oslo_messaging/hacking/checks.py', 'oslo_messaging/hacking/__init__.py', 'oslo_messaging/_executors/impl_pooledexecutor.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names. It also adds a local
hacking check to prevent regressions, while disabling style checks in
the "tests" directory, which will be deleted in a subsequent patch.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iad2ae13c771c99861ca9493c6ab10edcfbd8684a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names. It also adds a local
hacking check to prevent regressions, while disabling style checks in
the "tests" directory, which will be deleted in a subsequent patch.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iad2ae13c771c99861ca9493c6ab10edcfbd8684a

commit_message:
convergence: add adopt support

- pass the adopt data in next to the input_data
- since it is not stored in the db, assign the adopt data
  from the cache data in Resource.load()
- in service.py make it easier to enable convergence
  (just uncomment the raise NotSupported)

Change-Id: I3b3032602f18f86119c41a1bda29432e459c9966

commit_message:
Dashboard ReOrg - Move workflow into app/core

This patch relocates the 'workflow' directory because
it is application specific, but needed by multiple dashboards.

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>

Change-Id: I0c2d8bb9bfd5ea14c2d970293ad2707e324fd5ab
Partially-Bug: #1458697

commit_message:
Fix unit test mocks for new mock release

The new mock release(1.1.0) broke some of the unit tests which
were using incorrect mock methods that do not really exist.

Before mock 1.1.0 using such incorrectly mocked methds would
silently pass -- but after the upgrade these (rightly) cause
errors that need to be fixed.

Change-Id: I35fbd142a199f5e5f39b7835fee0ac888dc9784b
Closes-Bug: 1473454

commit_message:
Change keystone command to openstack command

As noted in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179650 , this file
still uses the old keystone command which has been deprecated
in favor of the openstack command.

This patch makes the switch, using
http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/openstackclient_commands.html
for reference.

Change-Id: I207b2d162dc0fca1266e0a895605665047d33a0d

add resource_name in list_stack_resources method

we need to add resource_name and with_attr in list_stack_resources method.

fixing oslo_serialization reference

Due to oslo. namespace being deprecated, oslo.serialization reference
was causing check/gate jobs to fail.  Updated oslo.serialization
reference to oslo_serialization.

commit_message:
Constrain mock < 1.1

Kilo was released with mock 1.0. Mock 1.1 uncovers a lot of bugs
in the test interface. We can either fix all of these tests or
pin mock below 1.1 consistent with what was released.

Change-Id: I299f98511be847319d5cb66da82316a3ff4adc70

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-26 06:53:21.000000000', 'files': ['etc/magnum/magnum.conf.sample', '.gitignore', 'etc/magnum/README-magnum.conf.txt'], 'message': 'stop tracking sample configuration file

All options in sample configuration file are actually default values.
It is unnecessary to track the sample file because user can generate it
automatically. As long as we track this file, it is our burden to ensure
this file is correct and updated, especially when it contains options of
oslo packages which are out of our control.

Change-Id: I26f70d47ed9786ffa5a298eb3e54169931d49cab
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
stop tracking sample configuration file

All options in sample configuration file are actually default values.
It is unnecessary to track the sample file because user can generate it
automatically. As long as we track this file, it is our burden to ensure
this file is correct and updated, especially when it contains options of
oslo packages which are out of our control.

Change-Id: I26f70d47ed9786ffa5a298eb3e54169931d49cab

commit_message:
Implement bay smart scale down

We currently allow Magnum to scale down bays by removing nodes from
the Bay's ResourceGroup by updating the heat stack that created the bay.
The problem with this approach is that Heat decides which node to delete,
and all containers on that node will also be deleted. This patch make
the selection process smarter: we ask Heat to delete Bay node(s)
that have NO CONTAINERS on them.

Change-Id: Ic4d754dfe358dd8aad020bc3b80a4c9f3f1525fc
Implements: blueprint magnum-smart-bay-scale-down

commit_message:
[EDP][Oozie] external hdfs missed for URLs in job_configs

If a job is run on data sources that reference an hdfs host not
listed in the /etc/hosts file of cluster instances, the Oozie EDP
engine will update the /etc/hosts files accordingly.However, this
only works for hdfs URLs referenced via data sources. If for
example a Java job is run with manually specified input or output
URLs that reference an external hdfs, the Oozie EDP engineu will
not update the /etc/hosts files.

Change-Id: I42a89a347cdb1bd6cc9d8b8c2b03b8a09d2e17b9
Closes-bug: 1425731

commit_message:
DVR: cleanup stale floating ip namespaces

During l3 agent periodic resync NamespaceManager takes care
of cleaning up stale router namespaces. This is true
for qrouter- and snat- namespaces. However stale fip-
namespaces also need to be cleaned up.
The patch adds fip-ns handling to the NamespaceManager.

Closes-Bug: #1470909
Change-Id: Ib6a8ae2ff66c0e1dd0978838c3f274748898f73e

commit_message:
Temporary work around of functional test failure

Unset variables OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID and OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID. These
variables are for keystone v3, but magnum is using v2 API.

Change-Id: I948e296f881033bd41f584dbbadd036cd9d29030
